column1: VANGUARD GROUP INC@"The Vanguard Group is an American registered investment advisor based in Malvern
column2: Pennsylvania with over $5.3 trillion in assets under management. It is the largest provider of mutual funds and the second-largest provider of exchange-traded funds (ETFs) in the world after BlackRock's iShares. In addition to mutual funds and ETFs

column1: Founder and former chairman John C. Bogle is credited with the creation of the first index fund available to individual investors and was a proponent and major enabler of low-cost investing by individuals. Vanguard is owned by the funds managed by the company and is therefore owned by its customers. Vanguard offers two classes of most of its funds: investor shares and admiral shares. Admiral shares have slightly lower expense ratios but require a higher minimum investment
column4: 000 per fund.In addition to mutual funds and ETFs
column10: and trust services. Several mutual funds managed by Vanguard are ranked at the top of the list of US mutual funds by assets under management.Vanguard's corporate headquarters is in Malvern
column12: a suburb of Philadelphia. It has satellite offices in Charlotte
column15: Arizona. The company also has offices in Australia

column2: Inc. is an American global investment management corporation based in New York City. Founded in 1988
column3: initially as a risk management and fixed income institutional asset manager
column4: BlackRock is the world's largest asset manager
column5: with $7.4 trillion in assets under management as of end-Q4 2019. BlackRock operates globally with 70 offices in 30 countries and clients in 100 countries. Due to its power
column6: and the sheer size and scope of its financial assets and activities
column7: BlackRock has been called the world's largest shadow bank.@7.43@['Laurence D. Fink|Larry Fink'

column1: EDGEWOOD MANAGEMENT LLC@Edgewood Management LLC is an employee-owned registered investment advisor in the public equity markets of the United States.  The firm follows a growth-oriented strategy based on intensive balance sheet analysis that is focused on building a portfolio of large cap growth stocks with a three to five year investment horizon.  Originally focused on individual investors and family groups
column2: Edgewood has expanded to serve an institutional clientele.The firm is headed by president Alan W. Breed
column3: whose father founded the firm in 1974. As of June 2016
column4: it managed 22 stocks with approximately $14 billion in capital under management.@NO INFO@NO INFO

column1: STATE STREET CORP@"State Street Corporation is an American financial services and bank holding company headquartered at One Lincoln Street in Boston with operations worldwide. It is the second-oldest continually operating United States bank; its predecessor
column3: was founded in 1792. State Street is ranked 15th on the list of largest banks in the United States by assets. It is one of the largest asset management companies in the world with US$2.511 trillion under management and US$31.62 trillion under custody and administration. It is the second largest custodian bank in the world.The company is ranked 247th on the Fortune 500 as of 2019. The company is on the list of the banks that are too big to fail published by the Financial Stability Board.The company is named after State Street in Boston
column4: which was known as the ""Great Street to the Sea"" in the 18th century as Boston became a flourishing maritime capital. The company's logo includes a clipper to reflect the maritime industry in Boston during this time.
